Module: searchïƒ

This module is used to search information in the neo4j database.

General usage:

ğŸ¦ > search <submodule> <filter> <term>

Warning

The provided search term must be a single word. You canâ€™t use this module to search for a complete sentence containing spaces.

Results can be exported to a csv file using the keyword â€œexportâ€ at the end of the command:

ğŸ¦ > search <submodule> <filter> <term> export

A csv file will be generated in â€œexportsâ€ directory.

search passwordïƒ

This module operates search on passwords.

General usage:

ğŸ¦ > search password <filter> [term]

To filter by enabled users, â€œ=enabledâ€ must be used:

ğŸ¦ > search password=enabled <filter> [term]

isïƒ

This directive finds passwords corresponding to the searched term. It is case sensitive.

ğŸ¦ > search password is P@ssw0rd

likeïƒ

This directive finds passwords containing the searched term. It is not case sensitive.

ğŸ¦ > search password like QwErTy

lmïƒ

This directive finds passwords using LM storage.

ğŸ¦ > search password lm

user_as_passïƒ

This directive finds passwords equal to username. It is not case sensitive.

ğŸ¦ > search password user_as_pass

emptyïƒ

This directive finds empty passwords.

ğŸ¦ > search password empty

Note

We recommend to use this directive with â€œpassword=enabledâ€ to see only enabled users with empty password.

search userïƒ

This module operates search on users.

General usage:

ğŸ¦ > search user <filter> [term]

To filter by enabled users, â€œ=enabledâ€ must be used:

ğŸ¦ > search user=enabled <filter> [term]

isïƒ

This directive finds users corresponding to the searched term. It is case sensitive.

ğŸ¦ > search user is user1

likeïƒ

This directive finds users containing the searched term. It is not case sensitive.

ğŸ¦ > search user like adm

search computerïƒ

This module operates search on computers.

General usage:

ğŸ¦ > search computer <filter> <term>

isïƒ

This directive finds computers corresponding to the searched term. It is case sensitive.

ğŸ¦ > search computer is SRV01

likeïƒ

This directive finds computers containing the searched term. It is not case sensitive.

ğŸ¦ > search computer like SRV

search descriptionïƒ

This module operates search on description field.

General usage:

ğŸ¦ > search description <filter> [term]

isïƒ

This directive finds descriptions corresponding to the searched term. It is case sensitive.

ğŸ¦ > search description is testsecret

likeïƒ

This directive finds descriptions containing the searched term. It is not case sensitive.

ğŸ¦ > search description like pass

non_emptyïƒ

This directive finds all non empty descriptions.

ğŸ¦ > search description non_empty
